name: Beets and Goat Cheese on a Bed of Spinach
description: I was inspired by Wolfgang Puck’s iconic goat cheese and beet napoleon to make something similar, but decided on a dish that is much less elaborate. If you have time to spare, you could stack the beet slices and goat cheese rather than crumbling the goat cheese over the beets.
recipeCategory: dinner, easy, quick, salads and dressings
keywords: beet, goat cheese, spinach, gluten-free, healthy, kosher, low cholesterol, vegetarian, summer
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar
2 tablespoons chopped fresh tarragon, chives, parsley or a combination

recipeInstructions.text: Make the dressing. In a small bowl or measuring cup combine the vinegars and salt to taste. Whisk in the mustard and the olive oil. Set aside.
Toss the spinach with 3 tablespoons of the dressing. Line a platter or individual plates.

Skin the beets and cut in half lengthwise (stem to root), then slice into thin half moons. Place the sliced halves on top of the spinach and fan them out. Drizzle on the remaining dressing and sprinkle on the herbs. Top each fan of beets with crumbled goat cheese and pine nuts, and serve.
